channel.title: Ubuntu-Rsbot Scripting
channel.description:
How do you compile your scripts on RSBot using Ubuntu?
I've tried going into terminal and typing: cd RSBot sh compile-scripts.sh
But I get a response that says "Can't open file compile-scripts.sh" Or something like "There are no java files".
I've also gone into the properties of compile-scripts.sh and checked the box that says allow this program to be executable.
Thanks.

item.title: Ubuntu-Rsbot Scripting
item.dc:creator: @HcoJustin HcoJustin
item.description:
@HcoJustin wrote:

…Just make the file executable, and you can double click, Run in Terminal. You have to set your terminal to hold itself open after the command is complete, but its not very hard to do.

Read full topic

item.title: Ubuntu-Rsbot Scripting
item.dc:creator: @xryz xryz
item.description:
@xryz wrote:

you have to tell the command line the path. try sh ./compile-scripts.sh or just ./compile-scripts.sh .that should work(find the file compile-scripts.sh).

Read full topic

item.title: Ubuntu-Rsbot Scripting
item.dc:creator: @theUnforgiven theUnforgiven
item.description:
@theUnforgiven wrote:

#!/bin/sh

cc=javac
cflags=
scripts=Scripts/Sources
scriptspre=Scripts/Precompiled
jarpathfile=Settings/path.txt

if [ ! -e “$jarpathfile” ]; then
echo “Path file does not exist. Please run RSBot and try again.”
exit
fi

if [ ! -e $scripts/*.java ]; then
echo “No .java script source files found.”
exit
fi

echo “Compiling scripts”
if [ -e $scripts/.class ]; then rm -R $scripts/.class; fi
“$cc” $cflags -cp “/$(cat $jarpathfile)” $scripts/*.java

No I haven’t, how would I do so?

Read full topic

item.title: Ubuntu-Rsbot Scripting
item.dc:creator: @theUnforgiven theUnforgiven
item.description:
@theUnforgiven wrote:

How do you compile your scripts on RSBot using Ubuntu?

I’ve tried going into terminal and typing:
cd RSBot
sh compile-scripts.sh

But I get a response that says “Can’t open file compile-scripts.sh”
Or something like “There are no java files”.

I’ve also gone into the properties of compile-scripts.sh and checked the box that says allow this program to be executable.

Thanks.

Read full topic
